SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess
Class PreProcessor

java.lang.Object
  com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.PreProcessor

public class PreProcessor
extends Object

Converts a DITA map file (or a list of topic files, in which case a DITA map is generated on the fly) to one or more .ditac files and a single ditac_lists.ditac_lists file.

The .ditac files and the ditac_lists.ditac_lists file are generated in the same directory.

The formats of .ditac and ditac_lists.ditac_lists files have been designed in order to be transformed by the XSL stylesheets found in ditac_install_dir/xsl/. The format of these files is documented in XMLmind DITA Converter Manual.

Using this class involves:

  1. Creating an instance using the PreProcessor(com.xmlmind.util.Console) Constructor.
  2. Configuring the newly created instance using methods such as setConsole(com.xmlmind.util.Console), setMedia(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Media), setChunking(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Chunking), setImageHandler(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.ImageHandler), etc.
  3. Invoking process(java.net.URL[], java.io.File) to convert the input DITA map or topic files to .ditac and ditac_lists.ditac_lists fully preprocessed files.

Note: This class is not thread-safe. Each thread must use its own instance. However the same instance may be run several times.

Specifies where to save the DITA map file generated on the fly when process(java.net.URL[], java.io.File) is passed one or more topic files instead of a single map file.

Ignored when process(java.net.URL[], java.io.File) is passed a map file.

setFrontMatter

public void setFrontMatter(int[] items)
Allows to add one or more frontmatter items to the DITA map (what ever its type: map or bookmap) being preprocessed.

Ignored if the items are already found in the frontmatter or backmatter of the DITA map being preprocessed.

Parameters:
items - which items to add. OR-ed items are output in the same .ditac file. May be null or empty.

HTML example: {TOC, FIGURE_LIST|TABLE_LIST} will cause a TOC to be generated in its own page followed by another page containing a List of Figures and a List of Tables.

See Also:
getFrontMatter()

getFrontMatter

public int[] getFrontMatter()
Returns the frontmatter items added to the DITA map being preprocessed. May return null.

See Also:
setFrontMatter(int[])

setBackMatter

public void setBackMatter(int[] items)
Allows to add one or more backmatter items to the DITA map (what ever its type: map or bookmap) being preprocessed.

Ignored if the items are already found in the frontmatter or backmatter of the DITA map being preprocessed.

Parameters:
items - which items to add. OR-ed items are output in the same .ditac file. May be null or empty.
See Also:
getBackMatter()

getBackMatter

public int[] getBackMatter()
Returns the backmatter items added to the DITA map being preprocessed. May return null.

See Also:
setBackMatter(int[])

setLang

public void setLang(String lang)
Specifies the default language of the DITA maps processed by this PreProcessor. This language is needed in order to sort the index entries.

This specification is ignored if the root element of the DITA map being preprocessed has an xml:lang attribute.

Parameters:
lang - a language specification following the standard. Examples: fr, fr-CA.
See Also:
getLang()

getLang

public String getLang()
Returns the default language of the DITA maps processed by this PreProcessor. May return null.

See Also:
setLang(java.lang.String)

setFilter

public void setFilter(Filter filter)
Specifies the conditional processing profile applied to the DITA files processed by this PreProcessor.

Parameters:
filter - a conditional processing profile typically loaded from the contents of a .ditaval file. Specify null to suppress conditional processing.
See Also:
setFilter(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Filter)

getFilter

public Filter getFilter()
Returns the conditional processing profile applied to the DITA files processed by this PreProcessor. May return null.

See Also:
setFilter(com.xmlmind.ditac.preprocess.Filter)

setForceTitlePage

public void setForceTitlePage(boolean force)
If true, force the generation of a title page, and this, even when the map contains no title info.

See Also:
getForceTitlePage()

getForceTitlePage

public boolean getForceTitlePage()
Returns true if the title page is to be generated and this, even when the map contains no title info.

See Also:
setForceTitlePage(boolean)

setPartRestartsChapterNumber

public void setPartRestartsChapterNumber(boolean restarts)
If true, give the first chapter of each part number 1.

Initial value is false/, which means that chapters are continuously numbered across parts.

See Also:
getPartRestartsChapterNumber()

getPartRestartsChapterNumber

public boolean getPartRestartsChapterNumber()
Returns true if the first chapter of each part is given number 1.

See Also:
setPartRestartsChapterNumber(boolean)

setDryRun

public void setDryRun(boolean dryRun)
If true, do not generate any file; just report error messages (if any.)

See Also:
getDryRun()

getDryRun

public boolean getDryRun()
Returns true if this preprocessor is used just to report error messages (if any).

See Also:
setDryRun(boolean)

process

public File[] process(URL[] inFiles,
                      File outFile)
               throws IOException
Converts specified DITA files to one or more .ditac files and a single ditac_lists.ditac_lists file.

Parameters:
inFiles - the URL of a single map file or the URLs of one or more topic files (in which case a DITA map is generated on the fly)
outFile - the directory where the .ditac files and the ditac_lists.ditac_lists file are to be generated
Returns:
the filenames of the generated .ditac and ditac_lists.ditac_lists files.

Returns null if a preprocessing error other than an IOException has occurred, in which case, some error messages should have been displayed on the console.

Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during this operation
See Also:
setConsole(com.xmlmind.util.Console)

process

public File[] process(URL[] inFiles,
                      File outFile,
                      File[] tocFile)
               throws IOException
Same as process(URL[], File) except that it returns in tocFile (an array having at least one element) the path of the ".ditac" file containing the TOC.

If there is no such file, then tocFile[0] is set to null

Throws:
IOException
